First aid treatment - Safety position - Lateral safety position if unconscious - Leg elevation if blood pressure low

question.title: What is the recommended first aid treatment for malaise?
question.description: Choose the correct symptomatic treatment for malaise.

option_a.title: Lateral safety position
option_a.description: A position where the person is placed on their side with a pillow under their head and legs elevated.

option_b.title: Leg elevation
option_b.description: Elevating the legs above the level of the heart to improve blood flow.

option_c.title: Safety position
option_c.description: A position where the person is placed on their back with a pillow under their head and legs straight.

option_d.title: Blood pressure monitoring
option_d.description: Checking the person's blood pressure to determine the need for further treatment.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option.
